facts: The Library of Alexandria was one of the largest and most significant libraries of the ancient world, containing between 40,000 to 400,000 scrolls at its peak.
The Great Wall of China took over 2,000 years to build and stretches over 13,000 miles, making it visible from space is actually a myth.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896, lasting only 38 minutes.
Ancient Romans used urine as mouthwash because it contains ammonia, which whitens teeth.
